citation.article-title: Enterococcus raffinosus sp. nov., Enterococcus solitarius sp. nov. and Enterococcus pseudoavium sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Enterococcus pseudoavium sp. nov.
Enterococcus pseudoavium (pseu.do.av.ium. Gr. adj. pseudo false. L.n. avis bird; M.L. adj. pseudoavium false avium)
Cells are ovoid and occur mostly in pairs or short chains.
The cells are Gram-positive and non-motile, α-Hemolytic.
Catalase negative.
Growth occurs at 10 and 45°C.
Does not grow in 6.5% NaCl.
Facultatively anaerobic.
Acid is produced from lactose, mannitol, ribose, sorbitol, sorbose and trehalose.
Acid is not produced from L-arabinose, amidon, glycogen, melezitose, melibiose, D-raffinose and sucrose.
Esculin and hippurate are hydrolysed.
Voges-Proskauer positive.
Arginine dehydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase and alkaline phosphatase negative.
Leucine arylamidase, β-galactosidase and pyrrolidonylarylamidase positive.
Group A type peptidoglycan based upon lysine (type Lys-D-Asp).
The long-chain cellular fatty acids are of the straight-chain saturated and mono-unsaturated types (Table 5).
The major components are tetradecanoic and hexadecanoic acids.
The G + C content of DNA is 40 mol%, as determined by melting temperature.
Isolated from bovine mastitis.
The type strain is NCDO 2138.
